data.current_description: Retrieve the settings related to the app's [channel connection](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#fetch-existing-channel-connection-settings).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the channel connection settings for a specific app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter. Returns the channel connection configuration including connection details and webhook settings. This operation fetches existing settings without modifying them.
data.reasoning: Description relies heavily on external documentation link without explaining what channel connection settings contain or what the operation returns. Missing clarity on required parameters (appId) and response structure. Enhanced description specifies the parameter requirement, return value context, and clarifies the read-only nature of the operation for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings/channel-connection_create' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too brief and relies on external documentation. Missing details about what inputs are required, what the operation returns, and the side effects (establishing channel connection). Enhanced description clarifies the app ID parameter, request body requirements, response structure, and the operational impact of creating channel connection settings for AI agent decision-making.

data.description_suggestion: Create and configure channel connection settings for a calling app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter and channel connection configuration in the request body. Returns the created channel connection settings. This operation establishes the connection between the app and the calling channel, enabling call routing and webhook integration.
data.reasoning: Description is too brief and relies on external documentation. Missing details about what inputs are required, what the operation returns, and the side effects (establishing channel connection). Enhanced description clarifies the app ID parameter, request body requirements, response structure, and the operational impact of creating channel connection settings for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Delete the [channel connection settings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#delete-existing-channel-connection-settings) for the app.
data.summary_suggestion: Remove channel connection settings for app
data.description_suggestion: Delete the channel connection settings for a specific app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter. This operation removes the channel connection configuration, which will disable call routing and webhook integration for the app. The action is permanent and cannot be undone without reconfiguring the settings.
data.reasoning: Summary uses generic 'Delete' terminology. Description lacks context about what deletion means operationally (disabling call routing/webhooks) and the permanence of the action. Missing input parameter details and critical side effects information. Enhanced version clarifies the app ID requirement, explains the operational consequences, and warns about permanence to help AI agents understand the impact of this destructive operation.

data.current_description: Update existing [channel connection settings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#manage-the-webhook-settings-for-channel-connection) for your app.
data.description_suggestion: Update existing channel connection settings for a calling app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter and the fields to update in the request body. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated channel connection settings. Use this operation to modify webhook settings or other channel connection configuration without replacing the entire configuration.
data.reasoning: Description is vague and relies on external documentation. data.current_description: Retrieve the settings configured for the app.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve calling extension settings for app
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the calling extension settings configured for the specified app, including menu label, target iframe URL, dimensions, and other configuration details. Returns a SettingsResponse object containing all current settings.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about what settings are returned and doesn't mention the response schema. Enhanced version clarifies the domain context (calling extension), specifies what settings are included, and explicitly mentions the return type for better AI agent understanding.

Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about permanence and irreversibility. data.current_description: Delete a calling extension. This will remove your service as an option for all connected accounts.
data.description_suggestion: Delete a calling extension and its associated settings. This operation permanently removes the calling extension and makes your service unavailable as an option for all connected accounts. This action cannot be undone. Requires the appId parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about permanence and irreversibility. Added clarification that this is a permanent deletion and cannot be undone, which is critical information for AI agents to avoid accidental destructive operations. Also clarified the required parameter.

message: Operation 'patch-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings_update' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about what can be updated, whether updates are partial or full, and what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies partial update behavior, mentions the request/response schemas, and specifies that only provided fields are modified, which is important for AI agents to understand the operation's behavior.

data.description_suggestion: Update existing calling extension settings using partial updates. Accepts a SettingsPatchRequest containing the fields to be modified (menu label, iframe URL, dimensions, etc.). Only provided fields will be updated; omitted fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated SettingsResponse object.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about what can be updated, whether updates are partial or full, and what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies partial update behavior, mentions the request/response schemas, and specifies that only provided fields are modified, which is important for AI agents to understand the operation's behavior.

data.current_description: Retrieve the URL that is registered for [call recording](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#register-your-app-s-endpoint-with-hubspot-using-the-calling-settings-api).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the external URL endpoint that is currently registered for call recording. This URL is used by HubSpot to retrieve call recordings from your service. Returns a RecordingSettingsResponse object containing the registered recording URL.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague and doesn't specify it's about the recording URL. Description relies on external documentation link and doesn't explain what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies that this retrieves the registered URL endpoint, explains its purpose, and explicitly mentions the response schema for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Enable the app for call recording
data.current_description: Register an external URL that HubSpot will use to retrieve [call recordings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#register-your-app-s-endpoint-with-hubspot-using-the-calling-settings-api).
data.description_suggestion: Register an external URL endpoint that HubSpot will use to retrieve call recordings from your service. Accepts a RecordingSettingsRequest containing the recording URL. Once registered, HubSpot will call this endpoint to fetch recordings. Returns a RecordingSettingsResponse confirming the registered URL.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description relies on external documentation and lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version clarifies what the request body should contain, explains the operational flow (HubSpot will call this endpoint), and explicitly mentions the response schema for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Update the URL that HubSpot will use to retrieve [call recordings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#register-your-app-s-endpoint-with-hubspot-using-the-calling-settings-api).
data.description_suggestion: Update the external URL endpoint that HubSpot uses to retrieve call recordings. Accepts a RecordingSettingsPatchRequest containing the new recording URL. The updated URL will be used for all subsequent recording retrieval requests. Returns a RecordingSettingsResponse confirming the updated URL.
